title.narrative: Buknari Family Dairy Farm Rehabilitation Project

description.narrative: Located on the Black Sea 205 miles from the capital Tblisi and 25 miles from the Turkish border, the Georgian village Buknari traditionally relied on income from farming tea and citrus plants. When Russia banned agricultural imports from Georgia in 2006, Buknari’s 316 households lost their main source of income. The community now relies on livestock for their livelihoods, though many there lack the necessary means to keep cattle herds large enough to support their families. With the assistance of Heifer Georgia and its partner organization, World Vision Georgia, the lives of 100 resource-poor households in Buknari will improve. In the first year, 40 families will receive 40 local breed dairy heifers provided by World Vision Georgia. Heifer Georgia will provide funding for the project implementation, monitoring and evaluation, as well as for training and agricultural inputs. After three years, the original recipient families will pass on the gift of 40 heifers to another 40 vulnerable families in the same community. All 80 families, including another 20 families, will receive training in advanced farm and animal management, as well as technical assistance and veterinary medicine to establish and run small-scale dairy farms. In the future, the community hopes to start agro-tourism enterprises in their village.
